archetype_name: Family Turkish & North African Suppers (Medium, 30–60, Intermediate)
name: Karniyarik-Inspired Stuffed Eggplant with Spiced Beef and Herbed Bulgur
description: Roasted eggplants stuffed with baharat-spiced beef and tomatoes, finished in the oven and served with fluffy bulgur, sumac onions, yoghurt, and lemon. Medium warmth and family-friendly, with Turkish and North African accents.
prep_steps: Halve 2 large eggplant lengthwise; score the flesh in a crosshatch without piercing the skin. Sprinkle with a pinch of salt and set aside.
Dice 2 medium onions and mince 3 cloves garlic.
Chop 1/2 bunch parsley and 2 tbsp mint (optional).
Rinse 1.5 cups bulgur in a sieve; drain.
Thinly slice 1 small red onion; toss with 1 tsp sumac, 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar, a pinch of salt, and 1 tsp olive oil; set aside.
Warm 3 cups vegetable stock in a saucepan or kettle.
cook_steps: Brush eggplant cut sides with 2 tbsp olive oil and place cut-side down on a baking tray. Roast 20–25 minutes until soft and collapses slightly.
While eggplant roasts, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add diced onions and cook 5–6 minutes until translucent; add minced garlic for 30 seconds.
Add 500 g beef mince; cook, breaking up, until browned and most moisture evaporates, 5–7 minutes.
Stir in 2 tsp baharat, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp paprika, 1/4 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tsp chili flakes, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper; cook 1 minute.
Add 2 tbsp tomato paste; cook 1 minute, then add 400 g can crushed tomatoes. Simmer 5–7 minutes until thick. Stir in chopped parsley and toasted almonds; adjust salt to taste. Remove from heat.

In a saucepan, combine rinsed bulgur with 3 cups hot vegetable stock, 1 tbsp olive oil, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook on low 12–15 minutes until liquid is absorbed; rest covered 5 minutes, then fluff and fold in chopped mint (if using).
Remove eggplants from oven and flip cut-side up. Use a spoon to press a trench into each half. Spoon the spiced beef mixture into the eggplants, mounding evenly.
Drizzle stuffed eggplants with 1 tbsp olive oil. Return to oven for 10 minutes to meld flavors.
Serve stuffed eggplants over or alongside the herbed bulgur. Top with a spoon of yoghurt, scatter the sumac onions, and add lemon wedges for squeezing.
